website_summaries.verdict: This mid-range 3D printer’s wireless connectivity, uncomplicated setup process, and user-friendly software make it a top choice for beginners.
cons: This 3D printer can be fairly noisy while it's printing

customer_reviews.title: Breaks in less then a year
customer_reviews.text: At the beginning the printer was amazing, however nine months after I bought it the printer had stopped working, I only used original MakerBot filament, and when I called MakerBot I found out the limited warranty is only for six months, I think if a product is less than a year limited warranty it should tell you something about the quality of the product .
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Miller

customer_reviews.title: A predictable, trouble-free printer.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent printer, the most appealing part of which is its bed: forget about blue tape, kapton or any of that: your prints stick to that bed perfectly and predictably, and then you can remove them by simply pulling off the bed and twisting it. For me, that alone is worth the price of admission, but the rest of the thing is great, too, as is Makerbot's customer service. Recently, experimental nozzles have become available for it from the manufacturer, along with such things as PLA filament containing wood, and so on, which greatly expands the capability of the printer beyond the basic PLA which, until recently, was all it could use.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Sutton

customer_reviews.title: A piece of $2000 junk.
customer_reviews.text: Print quality sucks. No heated bed, not auto-leveling. The print keeps wrapping all the time and no way to fix it. The support will send you the solution that you can find from their website. Save your time and money. Please don't buy. You will thank me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does everything but print
customer_reviews.text: Cool software, ok app for the phone. Worse printer I've ever owned. Extruders clog and jam constantly. It stops printing for errors for no reason, and even when printing their test grid will clog and die on you. Don't waste your money or time with this POS.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Katter

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Service
customer_reviews.text: I have been a fan and follower of MakerBot & Thingiverse for a few years. I recently purchased my first makerbot and enthusiastically started using it. A few weeks into this, my Smart Extruder Plus became clogged, created a huge ball on the end of it, and is now unusable. After some easy email exchange with MarketBot support and a few photos of the damaged extruder - they have offered to replace the extruder at their cost, which is now en route. This process could have been simpler or easier. A great reinforcing experience for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Long

customer_reviews.title: Awesome prints. Once I figured out that I should ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome prints. Once I figured out that I should turn supports on, things went a lot smoother.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Anuszczyk

customer_reviews.title: Easy to unbox
customer_reviews.text: Easy to unbox, open, and begin using. Note, you must use a smart phone and download the MakerBot app in order to initially set it up. I was not aware of that at first.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Lands

customer_reviews.title: Almost 3 months and my kids are printing all the time.  Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I read a bunch of reviews and was a little nervous. But I purchased this and we love it! Straight out of the box to printing in less than 20mins. It has now made fidget spinners, toys, working prototypes and keeps on printing. I change filaments all the time with no issues. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: kmdbkd

customer_reviews.title: they have been great little workhorses
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these to make fidget spinners. They both have been making about 20 a day each for nearly 4 weeks without a single issue. Using mostly Makerbot filament but have also tried just about every other kind sold on Amazon with only one filament brand not working well. So far, they have been great little workhorses.
customer_reviews.author: A Guy

customer_reviews.title: Super nice looking and definitely a badass machine
customer_reviews.text: Super nice looking and definitely a badass machine. I'm having a little problem with the print quality but I think it's all about settings. Do NOT get a used or refurb.
customer_reviews.author: JLD

customer_reviews.title: It will be great if there is more specific detail in setting up ...
customer_reviews.text: It will be great if there is more specific detail in setting up the machine. I have plenty of problems with curling even with raft for my model. I have done the Z Axis Calibration but it won't work. Then, I try to level the complete machine and it works fine but it took me 3 weeks to find it out. In general, the machine is great. I am considering buying an addition machine but using the dissolvable PLA for smoother surface. One big advantage of Replicator+ is the printing size. It is much bigger than most fo the machines in the market.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Yan

customer_reviews.title: I love this printer
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer! This is my first 3D printer and I had virtually no experience with 3D printing when I got it. It was super easy to set up and its extremely easy to trouble shoot (although I've rarely had any problems with it) I would highly suggest it. I print almost every day and have done many 20+ prints and couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Very good for my first 3-d printer
customer_reviews.text: Very good for my first 3-d printer. Helpful being able to wirelessly send instructions. Would be useful if MakerBot desktop would work with Tough PLA.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer A. Zemlicka

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, two bits of advice
customer_reviews.text: I love 3D printing and this printer. I had the 5th Gen and this upgrade is definitely worth it. Quiter, faster, bigger build volume, and in the same footprint no less. I do strongly recommend purchasingto remove items from the platform. I used to use a kitchen knife, but the lack of painters tape--which is nice--on this generation makes a better tool necessary. Second, make sure you're using MakerBot Print software, so it will generate the right raft for this platform. I was unhappy at first because of the bad rafts, but luckily MakerBot called to check on me, and advised me of the need for the newer software.
customer_reviews.author: Eliot Gillum

customer_reviews.title: Better than the 5th Generation
customer_reviews.text: Better than the 5th Generation, the flexible build plate works great, no more painter's tape, I can print up to 2.5 times bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio Zornosa

customer_reviews.title: Built so it's impossible to level the print bed
customer_reviews.text: This printer is a $2000 joke! Definitely something to stay away from. The printer I received was had components so out of alignment that I was unable to perform the bed leveling procedure. The basic design has no manual alignment capabilities. I cut my losses and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Bop3162

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Extruder Jams
customer_reviews.text: This printer seemed nice at first but I've had two jams which has ruined the experience. After the first 6 prints the extruder got jammed beyond repair and I had to order a replacement. Two months later a new extruder arrives and within 3 prints it is jammed beyond repair as well. It seems this printer only works with constant visual supervision.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Jaded by Replicator 2
customer_reviews.text: I teach 3D modeling and design at the middle school level. Five years ago we purchased the Replicator 2 and after hundreds of hours, it still produces clean prints almost every time. TDue to the success we have with our Replicator 2, we decided to purchase a Replicator plus for its larger build size and newer technology. I have largely been disappointed by the print quality and speed. After the warranty period, we also had to replace the smart extruder yet the printer does not produce the quality prints of the Replicator 2.
customer_reviews.author: Cyn

customer_reviews.title: The Printer for People Who Have Not Heard of Prusa
customer_reviews.text: Seriously. The Prusa MK3s is better in every way and is a quarter of the price. For ANY type of user. There is simply no reason a printer this price should come without automatic leveling, and use proprietary parts and materials. The open source stuff is cheaper and more reliable. You are paying for name recognition. We ran a fleet of six of them for an academic makerspace and they made people dislike 3D printing. We eventually donated them to charities, which despite the gesture I still feel guilty about, because they are makerbots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: support has been very helpful and now my prints are high quality
customer_reviews.text: We have one at work, after getting all the setup bugs worked out. Everything peeled up at the corners, table just needed leveled, not a z offset. Then I had an extruder alarm. I must say even though i've been in touch with support a few times in a couple months it has been a great printer none the less. Had the insurance and all. From everything I've seen with 3d printing this has been very good at producing high quality prints on the first print. On a hobby level i'd not buy it because of the cost. As a company using it for rapid prototyping and test parts i'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Avoid all MakerBot products!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible! Makerbot sent me one after 4 Replicator2X exchanges failed to work (can't make a circle without corners because of design flaws & cheap components customer support told me). Then on this unit, the Smart Extruders clogged beyond repair and had to warranty two with less than 40 hrs on each. I've spent $400 on replacement smart extruders in a month. I've had 5 Makerbot machines in 10 months. You will troubleshoot way more than print, and buy more parts than filament.
customer_reviews.author: ryan higdon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer
customer_reviews.text: This has been a very good printer so far. Although the price is a bit high, I’ve had two lower price printers and generally you get what you pay for. I really appreciate the ease of the software especially the ability to view your progress remotely. I suggest you consider getting one of these printers, you won’t regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Lack of heated bed kills this printer's performance
customer_reviews.text: I finally convinced my supervisor to buy us a 3D printer for prototyping. I decided to get this printer because it was marketed as easy to set up and use. We have had it for about a year and if I could return it I would. The prints ALWAYS peel off of the bed. I have tried leveling, using gaffers tape, glue etc to no avail. I recently bought and assembled a Prusa MK3S for my own personal projects and the difference in print quality is astounding. Save your money and buy a Prusa, 1000x better print quality for less than half the price.
customer_reviews.author: John T.

customer_reviews.title: Good, but the build plate kinda sucks.
customer_reviews.text: I love the printer in general. The print quality and software are pretty good. Only complaint I have is the build plate, mine got a small rip in it on the second use. Even though it is flexible, it is still to stiff to get off prints with anything near ease. I have not used other 3d printers so maybe this is a common problem, but seems there has to be a better solution. I am at the moment looking to use blue tape, and purchased a print removal tool to help with this, maybe that will make it better. Overall enjoying this product for home/hobby use.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Lemon

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: I got the printer for our startup and from the start, it got pretty obvious how terrible the reliability of this printer is. It literally can't print anything larger than 2x2 inches without warping out. We had to spend hours finding the right settings to prevent it and we still couldn't find it. Apparently the solution is buying "gaffer's tape" but if the printer costs 2500 usd it really shouldn't need that. Also the print plate also got bent so we had to order 2 new replacement plates. overall, just terribly designed printer.
customer_reviews.author: Uksang Yoo

customer_reviews.title: Decent Printer for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Printed two 1X1X1" cubes with four 1/4" holes evenly spaced 1/2" apart on all 6 sides and the tolerance was anywhere from .001 to .015. Temperature control seems to be off a bit, there is no cooling fan to cool the extrusion as its being printed so the layers often collapse due to the next layer above being added before the layer before cools enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Possibilities are endless
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. This printer was purchased by my employer for a project, now that the project is complete the whole company is free to use the printer. I have made several items with great success.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Starmer

customer_reviews.title: The Best Printer In The Market
customer_reviews.text: The printer was amazing. The quality comes out perfect as long as you tweak and play with MakerBot Print. Quiet printer and works exceptionally good.
customer_reviews.author: D. Shah

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and great customer support. Very user friendly and top quality prints.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The printer works great when it is working but I have had problems ...
customer_reviews.text: The printer works great when it is working but I have had problems with it from the very beginning. I will say the support team has been very helpful throughout.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Collins

customer_reviews.title: Wifi-enabled and easy to use for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly so far and it was easy to setup and get started. Our students loved the fact that it prints wirelessly from their computer, or smartphone.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Shameem

customer_reviews.title: The Best 3D Printer Available
customer_reviews.text: The MakerBot Replicator+ is the best in its class. I'm impressed with the device's sleek design, the overall user experience, and the consistent quality of the end product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best all around 3D printer
customer_reviews.text: Best all around 3D printer out there. Reliable, easy to use and connected. Seems like a lot of learning from past get were fixed in this one. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: ng

customer_reviews.title: MakerBot Replicator+ is a great way to start 3D printing!
customer_reviews.text: I have been extremely happy with my Replicator+! Easy to set up and use right out of the box. Filament is easy to load, display is easy to find what settings you need, and the new flexible build plate is great for removing prints without difficulty. Coupled with the updated MakerBot Print Software or App, users can use the printer remotely and check on their prints from anywhere. I would recommend this printer to home users or schools looking for a reliable device to get started with 3D printing.
customer_reviews.author: Keven Rinaman

customer_reviews.title: Really fantastic and rewarding product!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for a little over 2 weeks now. Ive been using 3D printing for a year or two for work and this is the easiest printer I've used so far. I got up and running quickly and first print was a 10 hour build that finished without a pause. Quality was above-par, and the flexible build plate made it easy to snap the part off. No major issues, although I wish I had a few more "materials" to work with, this lives up to expectations and I recommend for anyone that needs a reliable and easy 3D printer. Please follow up with me if you have any questions. I'd love to discuss further.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 1 month ago
customer_reviews.text: Purchased recently . Great performance from the app for set up and wifi use. It didn't a 5 star rating because the filament is super expensive
customer_reviews.author: Maika G Blackman

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent tool, and I’m excited to see how it ...
customer_reviews.text: I am in the jewelry business, and have wanted to explore desktop 3D printing to prototype my designs. Using this new Makerbot was a breeze from start to finish. I set it up using my iphone in under 15 minutes (yes, you can set this 3d printer up using an iphone app!!) and from there was exporting my designs and had my first print finished in the next hour. I’ve placed this unit on my desk near my computer and have been prototyping on-the-fly since I set it up. This is an excellent tool, and I’m excited to see how it improves my business. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: MakerBot Homerun!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is amazing! The printer combines professional grade abilitites with user friendly adaptability for any level of operator. The smart extruder + is unmatched in the 3D printing space as far as I am concerned and Thingiverse gives you literally endless design possibilities. I have run numerous of spools of filament, in an array of colors, without one issue what so ever. I think the MakerBot Mobile is also a key value added feature that is a must have. I am a huge fan of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: MakerBot Replicator + 3D Printer, with swappable Smart Extruder+, Black (MP07825EU)
product_meta.description:
Style:MakerBot Replicator+At MakerBot, we believe there is an innovator in everyone. 

The MakerBot Replicator+ 3D Printer is our most popular 3D printer for professionals, educators, and hobbyists with a fast and reliable 3D printing experience, right out of the box. Enhanced 3D printing workflow features including the Smart Extruder+, a full-color LCD display, Wi-Fi connectivity, and MakerBot Print 3D printing software are just a part of what makes the MakerBot Replicator+ 3D printer the preferred 3D printer for both beginners and advanced users alike.

The MakerBot Replicator+ 3D printer produces high-quality prints 30% faster than its predecessor and offers a 25% larger build volume. Improved hardware, like a redesigned gantry and Z-stage offer greater reliability and precision—every time. The included Smart Extruder+ has double the warranty of its predecessor and delivers a dependable, consistent 3D printing performance with superior results using MakerBot PLA filament—no matter the project at hand. 

MakerBot. Ideas in the Making.
feature_bullets: Your purchase includes One MarkerBot Replicator, One 3D Printer with swappable Smart Extruder+ in Black, 1 PLA spool, 1 flexible build plate, power and USB cables

Item's dimensions – 17.4" W x 20.8" L x 16.2"H | Build volume – 7.6” W x 11.6” L x 6.5” H / 573 Cubic inches | Power requirements – 100-240 V, 50-60 HZ | Material diameter – 0.069” | Camera Resolution – 640 x 480 | Operating Temperature – 60-90°F]
Works with MakerBot PLA Material - Large Spool, Small Spool & MakerBot Tough Material - Large Spool, Additional materials such as bronzefill, copperfill, and woodfill
The only 3D printer tested by NIOSH for environmental safety in the classroom or office space.Aluminum Casting and Extrusions for Motion Components
Winner of PC Mag Editor’s Choice Award, iF Design Award, Techcrunch best Classroom 3D printer

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
